definition: to check/to examine/to inspect/to exercise restraint

sentences.english: The first part is about the defined theory of the discipline inspection supervises evidence.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分对纪检监察证据的理论界定进行了论述。

sentences.english: To guide the discipline inspection on the institutions affiliated to the Ministry and the railway work styles.
sentences.chinese: 指导部属单位纪检监察工作，以及路风监察工作。

sentences.english: He is also one of the few ministerial-level officials from the discipline commission that has held online chats.
sentences.chinese: 他还是为数不多的举行网聊的部级纪检官员。

sentences.english: Should be given disciplinary action by the discipline inspection and supervision departments.
sentences.chinese: 应当给予纪律处分的，由纪检监察部门处理。

sentences.english: And how much did the government spend on this investigation, anyway?
sentences.chinese: 再者，纪检调查此事，又花了多少钱？

sentences.english: I’m going to recommend to the Disciplinary Committee that you be 4)expelled, Mr. Simms.
sentences.chinese: 我将向纪检委员会提议开除你，希姆斯先生。

sentences.english: To complete other tasks assigned by the Commission leaders and senior disciplinary and supervisory departments.
sentences.chinese: 完成会领导和上级纪检监察部门交办的其他事项。

definition: Central Commission for Discipline Inspection (CCDI), organization within the CCP which investigates corruption and other wrongdoing among Party cadres/abbr. for 中共中央紀律檢查委員會|中共中央纪律检查委员会
Central Commission for Discipline Inspection of the CCP
pinyin: Ji4 lu:4 Jian3 cha2 Wei3 yuan2 hui4

definition: public security authorities, acronym from 公安局[gong1 an1 ju2], 檢察院|检察院[jian3 cha2 yuan4] and 法院[fa3 yuan4]
public security bureau (government office similar in function to a police station)
party affairs/work within the Communist party
